title: Thick slabs of winsome retro geometry - Futura Display (Florian)
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828031644im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/ss_4193.134.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828031644im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/hos_5295.aa.hayday_lg.gif)

 [‹ Extended Retro-Slab?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828031644/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39234 "Go to previous forum topic") [NHS font? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828031644/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39296 "Go to next forum topic")
author: roquestrew

comments.content: thanks! now it’s the Daniel Johnston one that eludes me; is it possible that for the _N_ they’re just inverting Futura Display’s _U_?

If you flip the ’U’ upside down as an ’N’, “Daniel Johnston” could also be Futura Display.

- Lex

Edit: Exactly.

If you like this style of letter, you might also enjoy [Tourist Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828031644/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/lanston_type/ltc_tourist_gothic_alternate/) and [FF Moderne Gothics](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828031644/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_moderne_gothics/).
